answers.answer: if this is a first pregnancy for you, statistics show that in the majority of cases first time pregnancies usually go past their due dates, now lots of ladies will jump on and say that they came early with there first, all I'm saying is that if you go by statistics, you shouldnt have anything to worry about and your partner should be back for the birth of your baby :)

the baby will come when it's ready, however be careful not to overwork your self, ie lots of heavy lifting, walking, ect you should make it to 40 weeks a lot of people do. How far along are you? usually unless you have a history of going early you should be ok
I'm almost 28 weeks on Sunday. My man graduates august 23rd & I'm due September 30th. I don't have a job so I don't do any heavy lifting and yes this is my very first baby
Id say youve got pretty good chance of not.going into labor until hes back

I agree, first babies usually do come later, not all, but mine came 40+1. If your husband is going to be home at 36 weeks, then there's a good chance you'll make it hun, your doctor won't let you go any earlier, they'll stop it unless you develop any problems that can be life threatening, like preeclampsia, etc. I went into labor at 34+6, and they stopped it, so I wouldn't worry about it!
Oh wow.. they can stop it??! Haha I feel so old and I'm only 21. I've been having a really good healthy pregnancy so fingers are crosses. Thanks that made me feel a lot better

Sometimes they can, the sooner caught the more successful it is. Usually after so many weeks they won't though. My sister went into labour at 35 weeks and they didn't try to. Most women will go 37+ weeks though, so unless you're doing something you shouldn't (smoking, drinking, drugs) or have a family history of preterm labour it shouldn't be an issue.
They can try, depends on how far into labor you are!

My dr told me at 34 weeks they wouldn't stop labor. If your pregnancy is healthy you should make it to 37 weeks atleast. That's the earliest i've known someone to have thier baby, but her dates were probably off. Most pregnancies go past 36 weeks.

question: So.. I just need to know the chances of having a full 40 week pregnancy. My fiance is a 1000 miles away for school and wont be back home until a month before the baby is born and we both want him to be home when I go into labor but I'm watching shows and reading things about a lot of girls having their kid a month early and I just need to know if there's anything I can do that will help make it a full term birth for mine and the fathers sake
title: someone help please im freaking out
